2. NATIONAL ACTION PLAN FOR IMPLEMENTING THE OPEN GOVERNMENT PARTNERSHIP IN MONTENEGRO 2023-2024 (https://www.gov.me/en/documents/3b87202e-8a46-41ec-958f-f70655f86335 or https://www.otvorenauprava.me/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Montenegro_Action-Plan_2022-2024_December_EN.pdf )
Response to reviewer:
 Promotion and improvement of open data policy and practice5.1. Promote access to the open data portal on the web of all state bodies and LGUs

5.2. Award annual awards	for the best open data initiatives/projects


5.3. Determine the obligation to adopt annual plans for the publication of Open data and the obligation to report to the Government on the implementation	of those plans

5.4. Establish calendars for the publication of open data and monitor the Frequency of updates of published data (minimum weekly or even daily updates, especially statistical data)



5.5. Conduct regular consultations with citizens, the economy and other interested actors on the need to publish new data sets of great importance

5.6. The	launch of an open data hub (Open Data Hub), which includes open membership of representatives of public administration, business, NGOs, scientific and educational academic communities, with the mission of improving the open data ecosystem and promoting the reuse of data sets on the portal

14. Improve the transparency of data on budget execution of loca self government units (LGUs)
14.2. Conduct training	on how to publish municipal budgets	in open data with a visual presentation of the budget structure (budgets for citizens)

16. Promotion of open data at the local level
16.1. Organize an "open data caravan" at the local level, in cooperation with the economy and NGOs

16.2. Organize in-house consultative meetings with management staff in LGUs on open data

16.3. Preparation of an analysis of the availability of publicly	displayed Contact information in local self-government bodies and LLCs founded by LSU

16.4. Create instructions for local self-government units on data	disclosure

16.5. Hold workshops for LGU officials on data disclosure

Justification: The formation of the Open Data Management Council is underway. On the page https://www.gov.me/dokumenta/352c5ca5-d625-4125-bd7f-1061fcb3b672 you can view the latest amendment to the Decision on the establishment of this body. The open data portal still does not have full functionality due to a cyber attack on the network infrastructure of the Government of Montenegro (IT systems are gradually being put into operation for the sake of the security of the network infrastructure), so when the recovery process of the open data portal is completed, the final formation of this body will be started.

The decision was made on 20.12.2021. and Article 5 lists the tasks of the Open Data Management Council. You can view the decision at https://www.gov.me/dokumenta/1153751b-b38f-43f0-8a07-c8ee09b88233. The amendment to the decision was made on June 23, 2022 and primarily refers to the composition of this body, and you can view it on the page: https://www.gov.me/dokumenta/352c5ca5-d625-4125-bd7f-1061fcb3b672
The official formation of the Open Data Council is planned after the normal functioning of the open data portal is established.

This exchange of knowledge takes place through regular holding of workshops, some of them are of internal type and not public, some will be public as provided by the NATIONAL ACTION PLAN FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE OPEN GOVERNMENT PARTNERSHIP IN MONTENEGRO 2023-2024. which was adopted in December 2022 and in the drafting of which the international organization NDI was involved as support.
All institutions that publish data on the portal are obliged to appoint administrators who manage the process of opening data in the competence of these institutions
Workshops, webinars and other activities are planned, which we will conduct after the recovery of the open data portal from the cyber attack, so we will provide the URL later.

In order to speed up the process of digital transformation and improve the services provided by public administration bodies, the Government of Montenegro and the Ministry of Public Administration announce the launch of the Digital Academy - a platform for the education of civil servants and all citizens who want to improve their professional, leadership and digital skills in order to be more efficient, effective and competitive in their business environment.
The Digital Academy in Montenegro is one of the first strategically designed projects for recognizing the potential and evaluating the achievements of employees in the field of digital transformation and, at a later stage, the development of leadership in this field. The Academy will deal with the most important topics that meet the needs of modern society, respecting global trends and present challenges. https://www.gov.me/clanak/digitalna-akademija

The Government's work program for 2023, nurturing the principle of openness, transparency and participation, will implement activities that include proactive publication of data, reuse of information and increased availability open data, as well as ensuring quality participation of citizens in the process of creating public policies. https://www.gov.me/dokumenta/83c638de-063b-4bff-b881-03798b9d74c3

Justification: The provision of electronic services depends to a large extent on the availability of public records. On our portal of open data, the Metaregister has been published in a machine-readable format, records of all registers kept in the state administration, so that everyone can see which types of data are kept in the state records. After a cyber attack at the end of August 2022, the portal was disabled and now work is being done to recover the data published on it.

The step-by-step guide for the development of environmental indicators is based on datasets concerning the quality of water, air, soil  and designed to provide information on environmental indicators, as well as on environmental reporting. The main purpose of this document is to guide the reader through the general process that must be carried out in order to provide an accurate assessment of the current state of the environment.

The guide for the development of environmental indicators is intended for government officials, members of the academic community, the private sector and other individuals interested in the environment.

Justification:
Portal BInfo.me (http://www.binfo.me/portal.php) is a unique internet platform through which you can quickly and easily access public, online databases of legal entities registered in Montenegro and is intended for all companies registered in Montenegro

 based on public data from www.crps.me (available soon on portal open data) you can search through this by several financial and non-financial criteria:
- Ownership structure
- Related companies, on several grounds,
- REAL ESTATE owned and possible encumbrances, as well as pledged movable property
Response to reviewer:
https://100najvecih.me/?lang=en
- Regularity in payment of tax liabilities,
- Account blockages,
- Assessment of financial condition,
- Objective, methodologically and theoretically confirmed scoring model
- Detailed insight into financial data, indicators and business trends
- (In) solvency of companies
- Monitoring changes in several companies and being fully informed about changes in them
- Special search of the list of blocked companies, as well as regular and untidy tax debtors
- Separate lists of newly established, deleted and liquidated companies, as well as initiated bankruptcies in the period
- Special register of NGO sector in Montenegro
- Special register of entrepreneurs
- Data on companies from the EX-YU REGION: Slovenia, Croatia, BiH and Serbia
- Success history in public tenders
Based on this creditworthiness information, this company has developed a project of the 100 largest in Montenegro:
The aim of the “Top 100 in Montenegro” project is to contribute to the development and strengthening of the positive business climate through promotion of positive business practice, the largest and the most profitable companies, as well as biggest employers. This indicator will also facilitate better recognition and promotion of those Montenegrin companies that make use of their right to present themselves to the clients, business partners and social community with the stamp “Top 100 in Montenegro” and thus show that they belong to the group of the most important companies in Montenegro.
Reviewer 1 Comments: Do you know of other reuse cases where open data has had an impact on entrepreneurship and business creation? Also, please provide a link to the “Top 100 in Montenegro” project - that is a relevant piece of information since the current reuse case overall pertains more to getting insight into the business landscape in the country than to open data stimulating business development.
